definition: improvement/turnaround (for the better)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Concise, after receipt of the g frequently reply in turn good mood.
sentences.chinese: 简洁收到克勤的回复后，心情转好。

sentences.english: “The economy will get better very soon” around the world, Mr. Liu said.
sentences.chinese: 刘先生称，全球经济“很快将转好”。

sentences.english: A few days later the weather finally cleared, revealing a completely white north face.
sentences.chinese: 数日后，天气转好，白雪皑皑的整个北壁一览无余。

sentences.english: Part of getting better is to face the fears and sensations.
sentences.chinese: 部分患者再起作用下逐渐转好，直面恐惧和情感。

sentences.english: One thing I’d like to point out here is that it does get better in time.
sentences.chinese: 这里我向指出的一点是，它真的能使你及时转好。

sentences.english: Because of this, the economic numbers are likely to get worse before they get better.
sentences.chinese: 正因为如此，这些经济数字在转好之前会变得更糟。

sentences.english: The weather has cleared up; we can go out.
sentences.chinese: 天气转好了，我们可以出去了。

sentences.english: In the Telegraph interview, the chancellor said the British economy was "on the mend".
sentences.chinese: 在电讯报的采访中，该大臣说英国经济“正在转好”。

sentences.english: Highlights after know, immediately turn in a good mood.
sentences.chinese: 拔萃知道后，心情立即转好。

sentences.english: Your mood and your brain will thank you.
sentences.chinese: 你的大脑会放松，心情也会转好。

sentences.english: And here I thought Nick Cage was turning his life around.
sentences.chinese: 我原以为小尼克凯奇的人生转好了。

sentences.english: Forecasters said the tides are expected to subside in the next few days as the weather improves.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报称随着天气转好，潮水将在几天内退去。

sentences.english: "The labor market is not turning around, and that's key to the overall recovery, " said David Semmens, a U.
sentences.chinese: 劳动力市场并未转好，而它才是经济整体复苏的关键。

sentences.english: Receive GuEn brings money mistress, was turned for the better.
sentences.chinese: 情妇收到达谷恩带来的钱，面色转好。

sentences.english: At the present, the water quality of Lake Biwa becomes better.
sentences.chinese: 目前，该湖水质呈现转好趋势。

sentences.english: I haven't seen any improvement at all over the past few years.
sentences.chinese: 这几年来我丝毫没看到一点转好的起色。

definition: to slip (e.g. of clutch)/slippage/also used of economic indicators, statistical discrepancies etc
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
(of the weather) to warm up again
to weaken/to fall off
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
steadily/a steady pace
to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
specific to a particular stage (of a project etc)/interim (policy etc)/occurring in stages/phased
smooth/steady
to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to go down/to decline
to get better/to improve/to get well
air temperature/CL:個|个[ge4]
progressively/step by step
